item.title: [PHOTOS] Nigeria’s Youngest Billionaire, Sijibomi Ogundele Meets The King Of Dubai
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: Nigeria’s youngest billionaire and CEO of Sujimoto construction companies, Sujibomi Ogundele recently came in contact with the famous king of Dubai, his Royal Highness Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum during his visit to Dubai. The 33-year-old real estate magnate was recently featured in Forbes Africa as a brave young Entrepreneur, an astute businessman with the capacity to [...]
item.content:encoded:
Nigeria’s youngest billionaire and CEO of Sujimoto construction companies, Sujibomi Ogundele recently came in contact with the famous king of Dubai, his Royal Highness Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum during his visit to Dubai.

The 33-year-old real estate magnate was recently featured in Forbes Africa as a brave young Entrepreneur, an astute businessman with the capacity to change the Nigerian real-estate industry.

One of Nigeria’s most promising businessman, Sujibomi has been attempting to expand his billion dollar empire to Dubai and his short encounter with the king was probably in furtherance of that dream.

item.title: 6 Key Tasks Buhari Told New NNPC Boss, Kachikwu To Carry Out Immediately
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: A new managing director for the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC) was unveiled yesterday and he already has his work cut out for him according to new reports. President Muhammadu Buhari appointed Dr. Emmanuel Ibe Kachikwu, the Executive Vice Chairman/General Counsel of ExxonMobil (Africa), as Group Managing Director (GMD) and informed him that his primary [...]
item.content:encoded:
A new managing director for the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC) was unveiled yesterday and he already has his work cut out for him according to new reports.

President Muhammadu Buhari appointed  Dr. Emmanuel Ibe Kachikwu, the Executive Vice Chairman/General Counsel of ExxonMobil (Africa), as Group Managing Director (GMD) and informed him that his primary target is the recovery of stolen oil money, among others.

Kachikwu was presented with these six terms of reference by the President to revamp the controversial corporation:

1. Clean up the NNPC system of corrupt elements;

2. Recover all stolen crude oil funds;

3. Work with the Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) and the Directorate of State Service (DSS) to trace and recover  stolen oil cash;

4. Review the structure of the NNPC to compete globally;

5. giving targets to all subsidiaries and put in place performance benchmarks; and

6. Fix all refineries, which must work at optimal level, “even if it means using expatriates in the interim”.

item.title: 7 Things You Need To Know About The New NNPC Boss, Dr. Emmanuel Ibe Kachikwu
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari today appointed Dr. Emmanuel Ibe Kachikwu as the new Group Managing Director of the NNPC. His appointment was made public today and for all those who are unfamiliar with the name, here is all you need to know: 1) Kachikwu was the Executive Vice Chairman and General Counsel of Exxon-Mobil (Africa) and will [...]
item.content:encoded:
President Muhammadu Buhari today appointed Dr. Emmanuel Ibe Kachikwu as the new Group Managing Director of the NNPC. His appointment was made public today and for all those who are unfamiliar with the name, here is all you need to know:

1) Kachikwu was the Executive Vice Chairman and General Counsel of Exxon-Mobil (Africa) and will now be taking over the mantle of leadership from former NNPC GMD, Dr. Joseph Thlama Dawha.

2) Dr. Kachikwu is an indigene of Onicha-Ugbo in Delta State.

3) He is a First Class Graduate of Law from the UNN and the Nigerian Law School. He also has a Masters and Doctorate Degrees in Law from the Harvard Law School.

4) Sources reveal that he is a well respected technocrat with an impeccable record. He has also never held a political appointment in his life before.

5) Before joining Mobil, Kachikwu worked as General Counsel of Texaco Upstream and Downstream in Nigeria.

6) He has successfully published three Law books in Investment Law and Contracts and numerous articles in various Journals.

7) While he served as the Vice Chairman and General Counsel of ExxonMobil, he supervised the compliance programs of the company and dished out counsel on issues related to adherence with compliance regulations and anti-corruption laws in Africa.

item.title: [PHOTOS] Buhari Is All Smiles As He Is Gifted With Highest Honour In Benin Republic
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.category: Buhari one day visit to benin
item.description: President Muhammadu Buhari was conferred the highest honour in Benin Republic during his one day trip to the country during the weekend. The Nigerian president made an appearance at a military parade during Benin Republic’s 55th Independence Day Anniversary where he was awarded the title of ‘Grande Croix Du Benin’ which means Great Cross of Benin. See [...]
item.content:encoded:
President Muhammadu Buhari was conferred the highest honour in Benin Republic during his one day trip to the country during the weekend.

The Nigerian president made an appearance at a military parade during Benin Republic’s 55th Independence Day Anniversary where he was awarded the title of ‘Grande Croix Du Benin’ which means Great Cross of Benin.

See Buhari’s happy countenance as he receives his recognition:

See more pictures:

item.title: Find Out How MFM Rewarded Members Of The Church Who Graduated With First Class
item.dc:creator: NewsReporter
item.description: The Mountain of Fire and Miracles Ministries on Saturday gave out financial rewards of N91m to its members who graduated in First Class from different universities across the country. The General Overseer of MFM, Dr Daniel Olukoya, made the announcement in Lagos at the monthly live broadcast programme of the church, tagged, ‘Power Must Change [...]
item.content:encoded:
The Mountain of Fire and Miracles Ministries on Saturday gave out financial rewards of N91m to its members who graduated in First Class from different universities across the country.

The General Overseer of MFM, Dr Daniel Olukoya, made the announcement in Lagos at the monthly live broadcast programme of the church, tagged, ‘Power Must Change Hand’, which was monitored in Abuja.

He said 180 First Class graduates in the 2014 academic year and two others, who received NYSC Presidential honours after completing the National Youth Service Corps scheme, would get N500, 000 each.

Olukoya said the First Class honours award, which started with 12 students, had risen to 180, explaining that it was meant to encourage hard work among students.

He said the award was put in place to reward members of MFM, who were dedicated to their academic work, while also creating time to serve God.

A pastor, Shade Olukoya, and Vice Chancellor, Obafemi Awolowo University, Ile Ife, Prof. Bamitale Omole, presented the award to the recipients.

Omole lauded the recipients for their dedication to their academic work and also serving God.

He commended the students for making themselves, families and the church of God proud through their hard work.

Omole urged the recipients to appreciate the grace of God upon their lives, noting that many of their peers, who started with them, could not complete their courses for different reasons.

He called on other churches to emulate MFM by encouraging hardworking students through similar awards.

=

item.title: Why Europe Recently Banned Importation Of Food Items From Nigeria
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.category: European Union bans food importation from Nigeria
item.description: The European Union has placed a ban on certain foods from Nigeria being imported to Europe. The afected food items include, beans, sesame seeds, melon seeds, dried fish and meat, peanut chips and palm oil. A statement from the European Food Safety Authority disclosed that the foodstuffs were banned because they contain ‘a high level [...]
item.content:encoded:
The European Union has placed a ban on certain foods from Nigeria being imported to Europe.

The afected food items include, beans, sesame seeds, melon seeds, dried fish and meat, peanut chips and palm oil.

A statement from the European Food Safety Authority disclosed that the foodstuffs were banned because they contain ‘a high level of unauthorized pesticide.’

Nigerian beans were said to have been banned because they contain between 0.03mg per kg to 4.6mg/kg of dichlorvos pesticide when the acceptable maximum residue limit is 0.01mg/kg.

The food import ban is slated to be lifted in 2016.

item.title: How A Youth Corper Landed In Police Net After Helping A Stranger Use An ATM
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.category: How A Youth Corper Landed In Police Net
item.description: A Twitter user tells the shocking story of how an NYSC staff of an establishment got apprehended by the Police just because he unknowingly withdrew cash from an ATM for a stranger in need. Read tweets below:   1. For all those who readily help others to their own detriment, kindly follow my suceeding tweets. [...]
item.content:encoded:
A Twitter user tells the shocking story of how an NYSC staff of an establishment got apprehended by the Police just because he unknowingly withdrew cash from an ATM for a stranger in need. Read tweets below:

 

1. For all those who readily help others to their own detriment, kindly follow my suceeding tweets.

— Professor BookWorm (@EngineChux) July 29, 2015

2. My Sister just greeted me with a very sad news of how a young corp member got into trouble while trying to help

— Professor BookWorm (@EngineChux) July 29, 2015

3. The newly posted corp member had gone to an Access bank ATM to withdraw N3000 from his account

— Professor BookWorm (@EngineChux) July 29, 2015

4. Shortly after he returned to the office, he received a call from Diamond Bank requesting his presence @ the bank

— Professor BookWorm (@EngineChux) July 29, 2015

5. Moments later to te utter amazement of everyone, dude returned in fetters accompanied by policemen & Bank staff

— Professor BookWorm (@EngineChux) July 29, 2015

6. A heavy allegation of theft was slammed on him. He was being accused of stealing a huge toyota car and other things

— Professor BookWorm (@EngineChux) July 29, 2015

7. Bank Staff came with a video evidence of the corp member withdrawing at the ATM with a card from the stolen car.

— Professor BookWorm (@EngineChux) July 29, 2015

8. Dude was crying profusely & tried in futility to exonerate himself by giving a detailed explanation of what had happened

— Professor BookWorm (@EngineChux) July 29, 2015

9. He went to a nearby Access bank to make withdrawal when a fellow approached him feigning ignorance on the workings of the ATM

— Professor BookWorm (@EngineChux) July 29, 2015

10. He agreed to help & collected the ATM card. The fellow frantically opened a diary frm which he read out different pin numbers

— Professor BookWorm (@EngineChux) July 29, 2015

11. According to the corps member, he withdrew over a 100k jst as the guy urged him to be fast

— Professor BookWorm (@EngineChux) July 29, 2015

12. Unknown to him as he would later find out, the fellow and his gang had stolen a car frm which he got the ATM card

— Professor BookWorm (@EngineChux) July 29, 2015

13. The woman who was on her to block the ATM got a debit alert and hastened up to the bank -Access bank.

— Professor BookWorm (@EngineChux) July 29, 2015

14. Access bank then connected Diamond bank, his personal Bank and he was called.

— Professor BookWorm (@EngineChux) July 29, 2015

15. Pleas for absolution from office staff and concerned people fell on deaf ears as the woman in question kept spitting threats.

— Professor BookWorm (@EngineChux) July 29, 2015

16. Currently the corp member has been whisked away by police operatives and is currently at their mercy.

— Professor BookWorm (@EngineChux) July 29, 2015

17. I call on the @NYSC to wade into this matter and ensure that an innocent man is not made to suffer.

— Professor BookWorm (@EngineChux) July 29, 2015

18. Stop helping strangers with their witdrawals at the ATM!!

— Professor BookWorm (@EngineChux) July 29, 2015

item.title: FG Reverses JAMB’s New Admission Policy
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: The Federal Government has ordered that the Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board should reverse its new policy of re-assigning candidates who applied to universities with excess applicants for the Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examinations. The Permanent Secretary, Ministry of Education, Mr.MacJohn ‎Nwaobiala‎, revealed this on Tuesday after briefing President Muhammadu Buhari of his ministry’s activities and [...]
item.content:encoded:
The Federal Government has ordered that the Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board should reverse its new policy of re-assigning candidates who applied to universities with excess applicants for the Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examinations.

The Permanent Secretary, Ministry of Education, Mr.MacJohn ‎Nwaobiala‎, revealed this on Tuesday after briefing President Muhammadu Buhari of his ministry’s activities and challenges at the Presidential Villa, Abuja.

The policy had led to protests in certain parts of the country as certain candidates who applied to the University of Lagos were unable to register for the school’s Post UTME after the school allegedly made use of 250 as a screening benchmark.  The institution’s authorities announced that only candidates whose names were officially forwarded by JAMB would be  eligible to participate in this year’s UNILAG Post-UTME.

item.title: Three Nigerians Defeat Disability By Winning Medals At 2015 Special Olympics
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: The Special Olympics is the world’s biggest sports platform for children and adults that have intellectual disabilities. It is held all year round globally. The city of Los Angeles is currently playing host to 6,500 Special Olympics athletes from 165 nations to compete in 25 Olympic-type sports this year. Three Nigerian representatives, Damola Roberts, Teju Ogunlela [...]
item.content:encoded:
The Special Olympics is the world’s biggest sports platform for children and adults that have intellectual disabilities. It is held all year round globally.

The city of Los Angeles is currently playing host to 6,500 Special Olympics athletes from 165 nations to compete in 25 Olympic-type sports this year. Three Nigerian representatives, Damola Roberts, Teju Ogunlela and Adebiyi Olatunji  are already doing the nation proud by emerging winners in various categories.

Mr. Roberts won Gold Medal in 100m Swimming, while Teju and Adebiyi won Silver in Men and Women Swimming. See more pictures below:

item.title: This Funny Exchange Between Ben Bruce And A Twitter User Over His Salary Will Crack You Up
item.dc:creator: Michael
item.description: A Twitter user came after Senator Ben Murray-Bruce recently demanding that Mr Bruce should confirm if he had indeed given the indebted Osun workers half of his salary as earlier stated but the Silverbird television boss simply corrected his insinuations and gave a smart reply:   @walanga2009 I never said I’ll pay half my salary [...]
item.content:encoded:
A Twitter user came after Senator Ben Murray-Bruce recently demanding that Mr Bruce should confirm if he had indeed given the indebted Osun workers half of his salary as earlier stated but the Silverbird television boss simply corrected his insinuations and gave a smart reply:

 

@walanga2009 I never said I’ll pay half my salary to Osun Workers. I said half my wardrobe allowance. Wardrobe allowances haven’t been paid.

— Ben Murray-Bruce (@benmurraybruce) July 27, 2015
